item.title: A Specification proposal for using Waku for Carnot Consensus
item.description: Definition Reference $k$ - size of a given committee $n_C$ - number of committees in the overlay, or nodes in the tree $d$ - depth of the overlay tree $n_d$ - number of committees at a given depth of the tree Motivation In #Carnot, an overlay is created to facilitate message distribution and voting aggregation.

item.title: P2P Networking Overview
item.description: This page summarizes the work around the P2P networking layer of the Nomos project. Waku Waku is an privacy-preserving, ephemeral, peer-to-peer (P2P) messaging suite of protocols which is developed under Vac and maintained/productionized by the Logos Collective.

item.title: Status' use of Waku - A Scalability Study
item.description: Status is the largest consumer of the Waku protocol, leveraging it for their entire networking stack. THeir upcoming release of Status Desktop and the associated Communities product will heavily push the limits of what Waku can do.
